description:
My waiter was fine. Very personable (Roman).  All of the staff I encountered were friendly as well.  I ordered shrimp scampi.  The garlic and shrimp were fresh.  The restaurant itself is huge and appears incredibly old.  There is an elevator you can take to the second level.  

The food was brought out pretty quickly & I believe we were there around 2:30ish.  The second floor decor appears to be Italian influenced and it makes you want to sing a Sinatra number as you walk in.  

Ok back to the food; the sour dough bread was amazing and the free clam chowder (which was almost perfect) could have been a meal in itself.  I was so sad I wouldn't be taking the bread home since the hotel I was staying at DID NOT HAVE A MICROWAVE.
author: Deanna N.

description:
This place is situated in between other like eating stands, selling chowder, crab meat made in every conceivable way, lobsters, po boys, and other simple seafood plates. The main reason I chose this place was because of the seating and it's indoors which was needed on the day I was there, a bit on the cold side.
I ordered the crab melt sandwich which consisted of dungenous crab meat mixed into a salad a slice of pickle and American cheese. The sandwich was rather tasty and fresh, though I bit too small for the price.

The service was what's expected at a boardwalk food establishment, okay I guess.

Over all i enjoyed the place, though if you asked me to recommend it, I'll say if you need a place to sit and eat then go for it.
author: Enrique O.

description:
The worst at the wharf. 
Hugely overpriced. The fish and chips for $29.50 (why the $.50?) had 2 small fish fingers. 
And even they were overcooked beyond recognition. 
No wonder the place was half seated at dinner time. 
My pics say it all.
author: Jeffrey A.

description: I was in the area around lunch time doing some touristy stuff and I had to get my breadbowl + chowder fix so I wandered up to The Grotto. They have plenty of outdoor seating but since the wind was a little crazy we ate inside. The upstairs area was waaay fancier than I expected but it has sweeping views of the marina, city and part of the bridge. Even on a foggy day it was a nice lunch time view. You get complimentary sourdough bread which was hot, fresh and delicious! Not that I needed more bread because literally within minutes of placing my order the waiter showed up with a giant bread bowl filled with clam chowder. The chowder had a great flavor - creamy, rich and the leeks are perfect. However it was $16 and you can find chowder bread bowls for half the price at other places in the area.
author: Melissa F.

description:
$24 for half a crab in a fast food type setting.  Tasty, but not worth the high price tag. Chowder Hut is a stone's throw away and for around $28, you you can get an entire crab at a sit down place. 
Both have outdoor seating.
author: Alisa C.

description: Went here for dinner; the food was good but a little over priced for what we got. I had the bees knees cocktail which was really good, had a refreshing after hint of honey highly recommend this cocktail. Also had calamari for an appetizer which was pretty good. Took a while to get our bread though; I had to ask the hostess (who sat us) for some bread which she replied "oh sorry I didn't see you there"... ummm you sat us here... anyway over all good food good atmosphere
author: Kyle D.

description:
Decor: nice, old but charming. Looks like it would've been top notch in the 80s. I liked it though. 

Food: My husband and I caught the $20 lunch special: soup or salad with your choice of entree - fish & chips, shrimp po'boy, or chicken alfredo. We both got the same thing, clam chowder and fish and chips. The Clam Chowder was AMAZING! No searching for any meat here!! Just delicious and very warming coming in from the chilly bay air. The fish was beer battered snapper (if memory serves). The fish was just a bit mushy; not sure if that's because fish & chips is typically a flakier cod. Not that big of a deal, except the fish wasn't seasoned under the batter. 

Experience:  quick seating with a good view of Fisherman's Wharf. Wait staff was quick and attentive. 

Overall, I'd recommend this place. Seems like it has some staying power and you don't get to that with bad seafood!!
author: Dionne C.

description:
We had a fantastic group dinner in July. This was a very unexpected pleasant surprise! They recently remodeled, and the dining room shows it. All the beautiful furniture. They have one of the best views of the Golden Gate in town! Fantastic! 

The food was excellent, one of the best Clam Chowders on fisherman's wharf. The place is a little pricey, but it is seafood after all.
author: Greg F.

description:
It has been a few years since I was last at the Grotto. Discovered it's under new ownership. Sadly it has lost its charm and flavor. 

Menu was overpriced, lacked a fish of the day and most of it wasn't local. 

Caesar salad was large portion but ruined with cucumbers and sprinkled with paprika. Why? Maybe it's to compensate for the lack of crunch from the soggy croutons and drowned Parmesan or lack of freshly cracked black pepper. 

Entree was crab stuffed sole (one of two "local" fish on menu) but didn't have choice on preparation. Crab stuffing tasted like cafeteria tuna salad with its red bell peppers and celery. The sole was undercooked and sat on an island of mashed potatoes with spinach in a sea of butter sauce. 

The service, view, sourdough bread and wine were the positives and Mauricio was good enough to comp the entree that wasn't eaten. 

Advice to owner - keep it clean and simple. There's too many better alternatives.
author: Shea S.

description: Over priced, slow service and touristy. It took us 5 minutes to get seated, for no reason other than no one was at the hostess stand when we arrived; but the rest of the staff were very accommodating. As far as the food- the clam chowder was pretty good, crab was pretty good and dessert was pretty good. All in all this place won't be a huge memorable experience, but at least there was a nice view.
author: Nicole Y.

description: Our family popped in while walking around the wharf and were pleasantly surprised when we arrived upstairs. Everything had been recently remodeled and looked very modern and also classic. The view of the marina, Bay, and Golden Gate was incredible. With such a classy atmosphere we were also happy that they were so kind and welcoming to our young kiddos. They had a kids menu, special cups, and coloring sheets. The service was absolutely fantastic and very helpful with menu suggestions. I'd highly recommend the mussels in white wine sauce or the salmon. We really can't believe we stumbled into such a fantastic lunch and would highly recommend the grotto to anyone. This place is a gem on the Wharf!
author: M T.

description:
If you're looking for a place that has good service and food, try somewhere else. Ho- Lee- -sh- it was a nightmare. 

Let's start of with the obvious, don't bother trying to park close by, find parking somewhere and walk. There's way too much foot traffic and people not following the signs around the area. 

The restaurant is upstairs from their small dining area outside on the right side. Upon entering, you may be wowed by how the inside looks like and how clean it was. The host up front did an fantastic job and that was it for the night and started going down hill from there. 

There is no dedicated server here, everyone is literally running with their head cut off trying to figure out which table ordered what and where the orders went. 

You want a refill? Don't bother, unless you're waving the cup around, you won't get one. The server only came three times to our table, once for drinks, second for ordering food and the bill (had to waive the server). 

The food was very disappointing. First, you'll be waiting almost 45 to 50 minutes for your food once you order. The fish and chips and the shrimp and chips are way too over priced for what you get. The fish and shrimp are pretty much just batter and barely any meat. One of our other pasta dish came with frozen scallops almost, hard and we had to return it and get something else. The sandwich was burnt and dry like the dessert. The clam chowed bread tasted really sour like it was bad.

This place has been x'ed on my place and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone, there's a large amount of restaurants that serve the same thing.

TLDR
Server 0/5
Food 1/5
Parking 0/5
Pricing 1/5
author: Nick S.

description:
The food here I'd give a 4.5 but the service was phenomenal! From start to finish, our server and the host could not be more helpful, friendly, and accommodating! This is how restaurant hospitality should be! I felt like they were family! They were always making sure we were having a great meal and ensuring that we had everything we needed.

Aside from the outstanding service, the food was really good! My least favorite would be the lobster mac and cheese though which just felt a bit bland. Especially paying 32$ for that.

Keep in mind this place is pretty expensive! We ended up paying close to 300$ for what was supposed to be a quick lunch!
author: Jan L.

description:
It's Saturday and dad wanted to eat Dungeness crab. Street vendors on Taylor St. offer up a wide variety of seafood, including DC, however, finding a location to sit and enjoy the wharf's finest delicacies, was going to be a challenge. We opted for The Grotto.  

The wait was 15 min for a table. Not bad on a Saturday afternoon. A-

There is free 2hr parking in the lit across Taylor St. while dining here. A+

Bring a sweater or light jacket because it does get rather cool inside. B

The busser asked if we wanted more sourdough bread rolls and we said no. He took our basket which had 4 rolls left in it. We wanted them. D

Ordered Shrimp & Chips. Batter was thick and very alcoholy tasting.  C-

The cole slaw was excellent. A+

The clam chowder was very tasty and thick. A+
author: Maile K.

description:
Spontaneous brunch date with the boyfriend and we end up here.  Right off Pier 39, upstairs, view of city - not the nicest, but it was still a good view.  Anywhere you are in SF you always have to admire the city in my opinion.

The restaurant is located where the fisherman market is, though they have seating downstairs, they do have designated indoor seating upstairs.  There are parking garages and open lots that you can park on the pier, it's just getting more pricier by the year. 

The restaurant itself looked rather nice, it's not super elegant, but it has its nice touch to it. It's large enough to do a banquet, though I'm not sure if they're hosts or not.  

Customer service was a tad bit unprofessional.  I felt a little sarcasm from the hosts.  The waiter was nice, he made sure we had water and so and so...

The food:
1. Clam Chowder: The clam chowder was alright, not the best on the pier.  However, it was creamy.  I'm glad they gave it for free during the check in and I didn't have to pay for it.

2. Dungeness Crab Melt: I can honestly say I have had better Dungeness crab melt elsewhere.  It wasn't bad here though.  It kind of mostly taste all the same if you really think about it...

3. Semolina Crusted Petrale Sole: This was decent too.  I really like the richness of the Meyer Lemon-Caper Butter.  Definitely balanced all the flavors. 

Other than that, people I saw here were in their boogie ways, and they gave us like weird vibes.  Honestly though, IDGAF just because I don't care who you are.  But... I don't really want to come back. The whole vibe here sucked.  The food was decent.  But vibes are really what brings people back.
author: Nhu-Quynh N.

description:
Food is very good, but the reception girl was horrible. I feel so racist. Me and my family walked upstairs because the view is really good. You can see the golden bridge from the restaurant. The Reception saw me there, didn't asked me anything, she saw some more clients coming after me, she was asking them to add their name on the waiting list. I was just standing there for about ten minutes( it is a Saturday lunch, so not too busy).. five more minutes later, she will ask someone else but not me, I finally ask her" excuse me, I am been waiting here for 15 minutes but you never asked me if I got help". She apologized and finally got my name on the waiting list. 
So this is really bad memory in her, but everything else are really good. Our waitress Christina is awesome. She is really kind and professional. 

Thanks Christina.
author: Ying D.

description: I was so thrilled that they reopened.  I was in town for one night and begged my coworkers to join me.   Imagine my HORROR at seeing a large rat (not a mouse,  a full on rat) roaming the restaurant.   The manager didn't bother to pretend it wasn't a known issue.   The issue is "the doors are always open".  Took our drinks off of the tab.   You have destroyed a cherished memory.
author: Rock S.

description: This place is way different than what it was 8 years ago. Definitely recommend eating indoors! Friendly and accommodating staff. Price range is between $22 to $50
author: Paelo M.

description: We have eaten here regularly since we discovered it 7 years ago. The service is good and the food is excellent! We started with Calamari! I had the pan fried Halibut and my wife the Swordfish. Bother were wonderful! Check this place out! It is worth the trip!
author: Randy M.

description: We walked up to this restaurant and into the front door and just stood there.  There was a podium out front with no one at it and no direction as where to go.  After a few minutes someone came down the stairs and directed us upstairs to be seated.  While 95 percent of the place was empty, service was extremely slow.  We placed our order and it came in a timely manner.  We had to stop someone in order to get a refill on our drinks and to ask for sweetener for our tea.  No one ever stopped to ask house he food was or if we needed anything until we flagged down our server for the bill.  We then asked for more tea and it was brought to us.  From the time we received our food until the time we had to ask for the bill was over 30 minutes...with no a single person stopping to check on us.  Plenty of people walked by and said nothing.  The food was decent but over priced.  We paid ur bill left without even a thank you for coming said to us.  With all the restaurants in the area we will definitely choose a different one next time.
author: LeTia T.

description:
The atmosphere is great looking like a french restaurant !
The hostess were really nice, short waiting time for a busy weekend (5-10min).
The only issue was the service:
Ordered steamed mussels with sour cream and white wine (one of the main dish) but we get rusted mussels which was a starter. 
Mistakes happen that the reason why I noticed to my server that it was not what we ordered.
Instead of apologizing and try to understand he just answer no it's what you order.
When he finally realised that he did a mistake we brought a side of french fries (that were really good and crispy, however took at least 15 min) which was supposed to come with our main.
Sorry but I am working in restaurant industry too and I know that this is not the behaviour that you should have with your customer !
author: Agathe D.

description:
I'm not going to say if I could give them a zero I would because, in all honesty, the food was ok. The service on the other hand is deplorable. We waited more than an hour for food and received a sorry excuse for an apology. We spoke with management and they seemed to take care of the food delivery, but didn't make one gesture to compensate the meal. I'm pregnant and had a small child with me at the time we sat to eat. 

Common decency would suggest that the manager would at least come out after the food came to apologize. He wasn't to be seen after the food came out. What a joke! We will never be back and hope that no one experiences a similar situation.
author: Vanessa M.

description:
I absolutely hate to write such an awful review... but I am in the restaurant business and this place is horrible. I am very satisfied with the service. Lemar is awesome!!! Super friendly and kind. I feel bad that he has to work here. I feel like this restaurant needs to be brought up to date and needs a full menu revamp because it has so much potential. I feel like I'm eating in an old overpriced seafood house with the same menu since 2001. 

-complimentary sourdough rolls and butter that are served upon arrival are the best thing you'll have to look forward to! Bravo on those! Downhill from there 

-wines on tap, horrible (as anticipated)
- great view out the window "best seat in the house" see blow 
-rat trap under the table next to me  really!!!???? In view of guests. I understand the rat problem by the bay but seriously? 
-crab cakes, awful! No flavor. Tasted worse than frozen crazy cakes 
-Elevator music 

This will stay in business due to tourism from the warf..... no other reason.
author: Kiara S.

description:
The restaurant promptly reached out to me in regards to my experience. After accepting an offer to try their restaurant again here is my new opinion:

This is an amazing experience on weeknights. 
If you have the proper staff on board this ride is smooth. Epically smooth. That being said, I will not be visiting this place any earlier in the day. This is a result of my previous encounter, but I urge you as fellow consumers to be brave and try it out and leave a review. 

The food/drinks this time left absolutely nothing to complain about. In fact I may be addicted to the crab donuts, yes get them! Also the Bay Breeze that had previously tasted like powdered hotel juice was fantastic and actually garnished. I had two of them. For food we ordered Shrimp Scampi/ Sword Fish YUM. Perfect soft shrimp, in perfect sauce. Lovely swordfish on a bed of perfectly fluffy potatoes. The food was so good I even opted to devour their bread pudding dessert even with a full tummy. 

On our way out the bartender was friendly and gave us some great tips/tricks for our own cocktail pursuits at home. Thank you Mario, Oscar, and everyone else who made our evening so special. Will absolutely be back for some crab donuts!
author: Shannen T.

description:
Went here with family. First time in San Francisco. 
We order the crab melt sandwich. It was satisfying 
Also the lobster Mac and cheese it was cooked well but it lacked a lot of flavor. Customer service is amazing form entrance to exit. Flavorless food is what brings my rating to 3 stars. I should of done my research prior to going in.
author: Melissa Q.

description:
How I ended up here: 
When your friends wife says she wants to go to the Wharf for dinner for a change, let's take her to the Grotto. 

Ordered:
- Oysters
- Salt & Pepper Calamari
- Blackened Snapper
- Scallops
- Old Fashion (Bourbon) x 3

Oysters come out, come on. It wouldnt be right being at the wharf and not do it proper. They nailed it. 5/5

Calamari arrived and was immediately devoured, our table of 6 went through that as if we hadnt already popped into some nearby Chowder stand and had a bowl in our bellies. 4/5

Scallops were put down and we put them down! LOL 4/5

The Blackened Snapper. So much good flavor. Those fried green tomatoes, they don't look like much but they compliment that magnificent cut of fish just beautifully. I'd come here again and order this again, and again.  5/5

The Old Fashion number one comes out and its a hit. 5/5

Service:
Could be improved in regards to the wait time that our server came by to bring waters, as well as his return time to check on us as we'd been waiting for some time waiting to order. 

I'd come back, the food here was phenomenal. The service, I might just give them the benefit of the doubt, couldve been just the luck of the draw. Quite possible the other servers were on point. 

Overall the crew here is solid. Chef's to the hostess at the front, she was so warm and personable. Before leaving we decided to grab a couple more drinks, I went on to have 2 more Old Fashions and great conversation with the bartenders. Hats off to them. 

Great establishment, solid food, ambiance to make for a great date equally just a nice if your'e looking to bring family for a nice dinning experience.
author: Mike G.

description: Baited at the front with the idea of getting a free chowder by checking in to yelp. Fun fact! To get that you have to order an entree and  you have to spend a minimum of $15 per the fine print at the end of the menu.
author: Emily G.

description: After visiting the aquarium we stopped in for lunch. We had the lunch special for $19.99. This included a basket of fish and chips, a nice sized bowl of clam chowder and some sourdough bread. The food was very tasty! The ambiance was phenomenal as well as the service. Our server was very compassionate especially because we had a very tired and cranky toddler. I'm only giving it a 4 out of 5 stars because the fish batter was soggy. We would eat here again and try other items on their menu.
author: Maria B.

description: The staff is very friendly but the food is pretty expensive for what it is. Walking up to the second floor, I was greeted by the friendly host followed up with a swarm of flies on the way to our table.
author: Justin M.

description:
Consistency is key, but unfortunately, it's not what you get here. Being here before, I recommended it to some friends from out of town. After our visit last night, I'm highly upset that they didn't receive what what great before.

Although it didn't look busy, we made reservations ahead of time just to speed up the process. We got a table within 10 minutes, even though the wait time without reservations was about 20 minutes.

First impressions are key. My friends immediately hated the place because they thought it looked beat up and old. It's actually upstairs. Walk through the closed, ugly door and walk up the nice staircase. The restaurant atmosphere is really nice and spacious. It's a good place, I think, to have large parties.

We sat down. Staff member poured us water. Fresh, hot sourdough bread and butter placed on the table. Everything's going good so far. Things started going south quickly after.

Being courteous, we told her right off the bat that we'd like split checks. We thought it would make her life a little easier, but she insisted on assigning seat numbers and working from that. Sure, we'll go with that. Whatever floats her boat right? Fast forward to the end of the meal, we reminded her again that we'd like split checks. She comes back with ONE bill. Alright, maybe she didn't hear us. We got her attention and told her that there was a mistake and she didn't give us two separate checks. She comes back with two checks, but the mistake wasn't fixed. At that point, I would have just left cash and been on my way, but that mistake was around $15. No way were we paying $15 for something that was too raw to consume.

Okay, the food. We got - the crab melt with fries, fish and chips, shrimp and chips, clam chowder in a bowl, lobster mac and cheese, and seared scallops with risotto. Pros, they give you lots of fries. It was literally so much that I regretted not getting a salad instead. Crab melt and fish and chips were good. A little too much batter on the fish. The shrimps looked huge, which was initially a yay, but you know it's bad when the kid is peeling off all the breading and just attacking the shrimp. My friends got the mac and risotto. Long story short, mac was decent, but risotto was raw. She would have been okay with it, but even the scallops weren't cooked correctly. Not worth the stomach ache. We sent it back. They offered to recook it, but she went with fish and chips because it's something you can't go wrong with. They also ordered clam chowder in a bowl. The received a bread bowl. It's a measly $2, but that just showed how inattentive our server was.

I'm sorry I took my friends back here, but I'm even more sorry that they couldn't really enjoy fresh seafood in San Francisco on their visit. Do yourself a favor and skip going here. You're better off going to the street vendors. Save you some money and taste how good food on the wharf is. Yeah, you won't get the nice restaurant environment, but your stomach and wallet will thank you.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
A couple of my friends and I were visiting Ghirardelli square and decided to grab some seafood. We searched on here to find something to eat and I chose this place. So we made an online reservation and walked our way to the grotto. Upon approaching the front, we thought we were being deceived because the place looked janky and out of business. Eventually we figured it out and walked up the stairs to a more elegant and formal dining area. We were seated and the fresh and hot sourdough bread were placed on our table. My boyfriend and I ordered a clam chowder bowl to start. For entrees, we ordered the lobster Mac and cheese and seared scallops. The clam chowder came out but the server gave it to us in a BREAD bowl. I... I didn't want more bread... but whatever I didn't make it a big deal. What's $2 more I guess. The clam chowder itself was delicious. Flavorful and just the right consistency. The entrees looked delicious. I went in to cut my scallops and they looked translucent. So I touched it with my finger and it was lukewarm. But I pride myself on a strong stomach so I just took a bite anyways. Okay takes good. The dish came with risotto so I took a bite out of that and as Gordon Ramsey would say, " IT'S RAAAAAAAW!" The risotto was still crunchy and starchy. I took another bite so I didn't mistaken it, but again it was starchy and gritty. So disappointing. I was contemplating on whether I should just deal with it but naw no way I ain't paying $30 for raw upset stomachs and uncooked rice. So we told a different server and sent it back. I got fish and chips instead because you can't go wrong with fish and chips. Right? Anyways as I was waiting for the new order, I was picking at my boyfriends lobster mac. It was good but they were stingy on the lobster. Hmm. Well on to the fish and chips. The fish was good. Well seasoned. The batter was a bit thick but it was beer batter so it's going to be thick regardless. The slaw was bomb definitely cut through the heaviness of the fish. And their tartar sauce was excellent. 

So at the end of the meal, we asked for our checks and in the beginning we told our server that we wanted split checks between us and our friends. And that we swapped the seared scallops for the fish and chips instead. We got our checks and 1. They were not split. 2. They didn't swap out the seared scallops. So we told the server again and she got the first part right but this time she just left out the seared scallops. Soooooo we told her AGAIN and she finally got it right. But everytime she's walk away it would take so long for her to come back. My boyfriend never even got a refill on his drink. 

So all in all, service really sucked and the food was ok to alright. It's so overpriced but I guess they can charge that for being in the heart of Pier 39. I just wouldn't come here again. Better off getting the same food in the stands outside. Also it'd be cheaper. Oh well.
author: Ellen H.

description:
Ate here a few weeks back on a Sunday night when it wasn't too crowded. Had a great experience and great food. 
We started with cocktails in the Lounge by the fire which was an excellent setting. Drinks were good.
Then we got a table by the window looking out at the Golden Gate Bridge. The meal started with fresh bread that was excellent. Then for dinner, My friend and I had the Little Fisherman Plateau and the ladies had Linguine & Clams and Lobster Mac & Cheese. All the food was excellent and came out together. The seafood tasted very fresh! 
Overall, we had a great experience and my only criticism would be for the waiter to be a little more attentive. But I would recommend for those dining the wharf for great seafood and a view.
author: Brian S.

description:
I have been eating at fisherman's grotto number nine for 50 years now. I came with my folks when I was a kid and for the last 30 years I've been coming with my wife and daughter. Number nine was sold two years ago after 75 years in business. Scoma's was not open so I thought I would try the new menu. Not so much, should have stayed with the old menu, and the new one reads like a health food store in North Hollywood. I came for  fried shellfish combo  ended up having a crab sandwich which was not bad, JUNE I had shrimp in a frying pan that was not so bad, The old fisherman's grotto is gone for ever but I would recommend everyone check for themselves,

I am the most obedient servant, Daniel Jones
author: Danny J.

description: We were there in for happy specials upstairs. Chowder, popcorn shrimp, a beer, very reasonably priced. Here in SFO for the week, will return.
author: Craig S.

description: Nice place, very clean, modern & classy. Great food & service. The menu isn't that big but the food quality is great. And large clean restrooms!
author: Fred F.

description:
If u live in SF, do me a favor
Pass on this
Especially for dinner

Its a no no
Read the other reviews
author: Playground C.

description: Crab cakes and calamari were wonderful!! Pricey so be prepared to break some bank..how ever I wasn't too happy with the surf and turf I ordered.. meat was really plain and chewy for a 73$ meal.. also the view would have been nice if they're weren't any trash in the water and hobos laying around.. I would consider checking out other spots then this one..
author: Brandon V.

description:
We had no idea that the place had changed hands and had just reopened.

The decor inside was retro, but the new type of retro that does not feel dark, old and greasy.

Our server was so sweet and nice.

Bread was amazing, loved the warm sourdough rolls.

We had:
Clam Chowder, wonderful. Not too thick
Fish Tacos, totally exceeded expectations
Kids pasta, delicious

The gin and tonic was a bit of a bust (more tonic than gin..)

Anyhow, might go back, but I fell fairly certain this was our one and only stop for this restaurant.
author: Kate F.

description: Great ambiance, service amazing, great views in and out of the restaurant.  Food is very delicious. Waiters are very friendly and attentive. They also validate for 2 hours
author: Junior M.

description:
Just visited New Fishermen Grotto! It was fantastic!
The food was absolutely delicious! The crab donuts  is amazing! The Cioppino is to die for !!!The They did a great job renovating the restaurant.
We will definitely go back!
author: Margarita C.

description: A must visit seafood place in Fisherman's Wharf! I ordered fried popcorn shrimp as a appetizer and it was super fresh. The coat was very crunchy and the shrimp was not greasy at all. I also tried their famous Grotto (Clam) Chowder...Oh my gosh! The seasoning and ingredients made my taste buds go crazy. I've never had clam chowder this good! I also had Chicken Alfredo pasta, which was seasoned very well and yummy. Overall, I was impressed with the ambiance, service, and food. I was not expecting this at all from this place, and to top it off the restaurant area upstairs had an AMAZING view while I sat and enjoyed this.
author: Jayna W.

description: I'm a San Francisco native and my family has been going hear for over 50 years,  this was my go to restaurant when I wanted to impress my dates.  I went there this pass Saturday and I will never go again.  After 150years with the same family ownership they sold it 2 years ago,  the food SUCKED. the service SUCKED . I'm sad to say my FAVORITE place to go  no longer exist.  The should have at the least retained the cooks.
author: Gregory H.

description: I went to this place with a group of 5. I've been in this place many times before they remodeled it. The food was okay. The service was also okay. I had a bread clam chowder but it was 90% bread & 10% chowder, I attached a photo to see. Plus we all received our food at the same time except one of us, he received his food till everyone in the table finished eating. I felt so bad cuz I was the one who brought them to this place unfortunately :( never going back again
author: Amir E.

description: We knew we couldn't leave San Francisco without trying the famous clam chower in a bread bowl. There are many places that serve clam chowder, but I'm so glad I picked this place. The restaurant was beautiful with a great view of the wharf. Everything we tried was delicious. Try the fresh oysters! Great menu selection, average service. If you're into seafood, give this place a try.
author: Vahe T.

description:
We aren't tourists but enjoy walking through the Wharf, and we stumbled upon this restaurant during happy hour. The hostess was incredibly sweet, and let us sit in the dining area (even though it wasn't technically for happy hour). The bar tender/ person who served us was SO SWEET. She was extremely attentive, and made sure we were always taken care of. I had 4 glasses of wine (don't judge), my bf had a beer & 3 cocktails. Only 5 dollars for wine and 4 for cocktails during happy hour!!
I'm not a fan of calamari, but my bf was craving it so we bought some during happy hour ($9). IT WAS SO YUMMY. I have switched to liking calamari just because of this restaurant. 
The oysters also had delicious sauces on the side (let's get real, the sauces are the best part) and were a great deal ($9 for 6!!). I highly recommend coming here for happy hour or dinner!! So satisfied.
Oh also, I love their music!! They have a playlist of Frank Sinatra and other old timey songs and I feel like it really added to the experience.
author: Tiffany S.

description: Had a great birthday meal here this past weekend! Started with a few drinks in the bar. Great happy hour drinks, appetizers and service! Dinner was wonderful as well. Had a $40 lobster dinner! My friends had the steamed clams and Cioppino! We Loved the ambiance after coming off a crazy , loud and busy tourist area. We've lived in SF for over 10 years and was pleasantly surprised by how quiet and pleasant the resteraunt was inside. Service was attentive and just right. Nobody hovered. This is a fun place to bring family or just hang out at the bar!
author: Michelle C.

description: Came here for happy hour. Food was very good. Service was awesome especially David the bartender. He was so friendly and kind. Will definitely be back.
author: Zina D.

description: Had to get my fixing for the clam chowder everyone said I must have. We made some friends, one who was a local. He brought us here since we were on a time crunch to catch our flight out. The clam chowder certainly did not disappoint. If only it was bottomless chowder! Highly recommend
author: Diana M.

description: Old #9 is back and it is as good as ever. Service was solid, view is outstanding, the place is clean and fresh and this San Francisco institution is back! Muscles are outstanding and the best Cioppino at the Wharf.
author: Scott J.

description: This was one of the best seafood places we've been to in San Francisco. Recently remodeled, the main dining room overlooks the bay. The food is exceptional, the staff attentive. Wonderful full bar. With so many choices on Fisherman's Wharf, this is one place we went to twice during our visit.  Highly recommended.
author: Donald H.

description: This was my first time visiting San Francisco with family. We were attracted to the city view and $20 lunch special. The chowder soup was delicious, however, the rest of the food and the service was horrible. We asked for a house wine and were overcharged. It was $60 per carafe, which was not even a fill bottle of wine. When we questioned it, we were told that it was more than 5 glasses in the carafe, which was not true. There were 3 glasses total. The waiter was rude and asked which card we will be using to  leave him a tip. The were many flys around the seafood displayed areas, which made us question the cleanliness of the place. When we addressed the Wine charge with the hostess, she did not give us a reason for $60 charge but simply said it was a good quality wine. They did nothing to resolve the issue.
author: Irina G.

description: Started with crab cakes and the clam chowder, both delicious. Had the crab melt and the seafood spaghetti as entrees, also very tasteful. They had table sourdough bread that was warm and so good! Probably the best I've had. Server was Mauricio and he was very kind and attentive.
author: Marilynn F.

description:
I came here for my mothers retirement dinner. We had quite a large group - 16 or so, meaning whatever happened we'd end up paying 20% gratuity anyway.

This sucks because the service, although polite, was superrrr slow. We'd been waiting at least 40 min - 1 hour before we all got our drinks and apps.

I wasn't crazy about the food. My seafood salad was okay, my sister said her clam chowder was flavorless, the ceviche was weird like it had fake guacamole or something? I don't know, couldn't put my finger on it. Not like the food was unpalatable, it just wasn't great.

I ordered the cardinale cocktail. It's not my style but I guess that's my fault for experimenting.. 

Overall, I'm not sure it's worth the price. Maybe you're paying for the ambience given it's in one of the city's prime locations, but you're definitely not paying for the food or service.

Honestly, this place is just "meh".
author: Cheri M.

description: Cool vibe but service is kind of bad. They charged the wrong amount and forgot my drink. The only good thing is the cute host at the front. There are plenty of other places to eat in the area.
author: Tony H.

description: Worst service ever! I made reservations here 3 months prior to coming in for my birthday. When we arrived, the hostess could not find our reservation. When she did, she took us back to our table, a manager (I'm guessing) stopped her and us in the middle of the restaurant and told her to take us back to the hostess desk because our table wasn't ready. Finally we get seated, wait 20 minutes and no one came to greet us or take our drink order. Needless to say, we got up and left.
author: Briana G.

description: I went to Fisherman's Grotto #9 on 9/23/18 to have my favorite meal of all time. I started coming here in 1970 when I was 16 with my boyfriend. I loved this place so much. I always had my favorite Lobster Thermidor. Pricey but OMG it was fantastic.  I looked up their on menu on Yelp to make sure it was still on the menu only to be oh so disappointed when I arrived to find out it wasn't on the menu anymore. They remodeled a bit and changed their menu a whole bunch. I will have to go to Alioto's next time for my Lobster Thermidor. I hope it's as good at Alioto's. Or you can bring back the menu that kept you in business all these years.
author: Sharon E.

description: The place is located at the 2nd level of what appears to be an abandoned restaurant downstairs. Interior was modern and clean, with a nice view of Fisherman's Warf. Took a while to get noticed and get water out though. Food came out rather quickly, but was mediocre at best for the price. Lobster Mac n Cheese was bland, and the crab melt was pretty small. Overall 3/5...might be a 4 if service was better.
author: Juan A.

description: The building itself is beautiful. If you sit in the dining room, you've got a view that is worth going to. We sat in the bar for happy hour, which is just kind of a dark, small area. No complaints, just bitter having to sit in there after seeing the view from every table in the dining room. Happy hour deals were good, calamari was good. It did the job, just wouldn't go out of my way to go back.
author: Maria M.

description:
Dropped by today (aug. 18th) not knowing where to eat in San Francisco.  I'm here for my birthday weekend and I've never experienced such a HORRIBLE service from any restaurant.  This behavior was unacceptable.  We stopped here because Fisherman's Wharf is a must do in San Francisco, the restaurant looked nice and what caught my attention was the Smoked Salmon plate with bagel.  But what REALLY caught my attention was when the host outside said they had an upstairs seating section with the view of the Golden Gate Bridge, who doesn't want to see that?  

To the food now, the food was ok.  The appetizers were better than the actual meal.  We are there eating our appetizers then our food comes.  Our server starts taking our dishes away without asking us if we were ok.  We had about 8 more shrimp to eat and he took it.  We all starred at each other with a WTF face.  I look at my plate and my greens looked pale, they felt warm.  The bagel, it wasn't a bagel, it felt and tasted like a brioche bun.  The red onions looked old.  The ONLY thing that was cold and looked legit were the tomatoes and just because they were seasoned with salt and pepper after they had sliced them.  My boyfriends crab Benedict did not include the Canadian bacon, he specifically said can you please add the crab, he did NOT say to substitute the Canadian bacon for crab, he wanted both.   The server was nowhere to be seen so we asked a busser that we needed service.  The server comes to us within minutes and said what's wrong, we explained but he didn't apologize, he just said I'll bring it right now, he didn't make an effort to take the plate back and remake it.  The friend then asked for hot sauce, he only offered her tobasco but she can't have tobasco and she asked if they had anything else and he said "you're going to have to wait because I have to go downstairs and grab it for you, so you'll have to wait". That was SO uncalled for.  Minutes later he comes back with the hot sauce and REGULAR BACON.  My boyfriend at that point lost his appetite.  He did NOT want to eat anymore, we called over the busser again because we didn't see our server and within seconds the server comes and asks what's wrong.  I explained everything.  He wanted to make things right by taking back the plate and actually doing it right but we said no, he said he had spoken to the manager and that the plate was taken off our bill, we didn't ask them to, we told him we would gladly pay for it.  I then lost my appetite and so did my friend, we ask for the bill and the server comes and SLAMS the check on the table saying HERE YOU GO! I stare and my friend and say WOW! That right there did it for me.  I would NEVER, in a million years act like that towards anyone if I were a server, which I AM!  This was SO unprofessional and rude, I was just shocked.  This is my first time visiting this city and I already hate it.  You sir need to check your attitude before starting your shift, leave your problems behind because once you clock in...you're working for someone who is paying you to treat their customers right, if you don't serve people YOU don't get paid.  

I will NEVER step foot in this restaurant again, not even after having spoken to the manager which offered me to come back, I just can't believe what I experienced here today.  


I usually don't read reviews before visiting a restaurant because I want to have my OWN experience but after reading their reviews it must say, THE REVIEWS ARE TRUE....do NOT come here if you want a nice experience, it's NOT worth it.
author: Alfredo S.

description: This was advertised as a fine dining. Unfortunately I felt that I over payed for the quality food that was presented. Nice restaurant over all. I would definitely go check a different place next time.
author: Eduardo P.

description:
We had fresh clams as a starter, I had clams and linguine, a couple of drinks, but the food was amazing, the service was thoughough, but not bothering us, fun, great food, bring good company - and you'll have a great experience.

I'm coming back.
author: Grizzly M.

description: The appetizers that I want is not available,so end up with the steam mussels with lemon butter, I ORDERED BLACKENED SNAPPER, again not available, so end up with something, I can't remember what's the name of it,we waited for 30 minutes to be seated, waited another 30 minutes for our appetizer to arrive, another long 30 minutes for our entree,the clock is ticking because the parking 12$ per HOUR, and its says no more than 45 minutes , my husband and I is not happy with the service, very slow,
author: Kristine I.

description: My goodness what an amazing restaurant!!! The dining experience was beautiful. We ordered the special clam chowder bowl with melted cheese and shrimp...MIND BLOWN!!! Absolutely LOVED it!!! Everything was delicious, the service was great, and the view was nice. Will definitely be going back.
author: Rocco T.

description: We just ate at the Grotto the newly refreshed space and it was great. I started with the chowder and it was one of the best I've ever had followed by the scallops and risotto . Very tasty. My bf had the Cioppino and said it was excellent. Cheesecake for dessert was to die for. We will be back. Good beer and wine list. Nice views of the Golden Gate Bridge.
author: Alisson M.

description: I'm gonna try to help out. Soft opening ! Beautiful place... Remodel on the wharf. Hanging out with Jonny at the Sinatra Bar in the Grotto! Pay him a visit day time ! I'm in the lounge.  Nicest spot on the wharf !
author: Joe D.

description: The clam chowder was really good. Not only that but the service was even better. The guy downstairs at no9 Fishermans grotto is very friendly.
author: Jen K.

description:
Worst treatment I ever received from any restaurant.  
Came here yestersday at around 11 am with my family visiting from Australia. The place looks decent from outside but nobody was at the door to greet us so we seated ourselves at the outside dining area. Few minutes later, an Asian man (seemed to be the one in-charged) approached us and mentioned that part of the outside dining area is still closed until 11:30am. He pointed on the other side for us to stay and suggested to buy our food from the self-serve counter. My family seated themselves at the available table in the area where he pointed out. While I was in line waiting for my turn to place an order, this same  arrogant Asian man approached me again for the second time to tell me that the table for 4 where my family had occupied will be for other customers that comes in group. (There are four of us, by the way). Technically, he is kicking us out.  I felt so embarrassed after my mother asked me why we were being discriminated.  I could have asked and argued with this man but we were starving and all I want to do was get out from that lousy place and eat somewhere else. Thank goodness, BOUDIN was just right there across the parking lot... and they were fantastic! The place, food and service.
Tip: If you don't want to ruin your day, do not consider coming to this place.  I am not surprised when I learned of the bad ratings here in YELP.  I should have checked Yelp first.
author: Brad C.

description: This place was way more deserving of the ratings it has received. It is newly renovated and beautiful inside. It has an amazing view of the sunset over the Golden Gate Bridge. The food was way better than expected. We ordered the fish tacos and house special which was halibut. All of it was tasty. The help was attentive and everything came out in a timely fashion.
author: Vanessa S.

description: We werent sure what to expect but i can honestly say this is one of the best restaraunts my husband n i have dined in. The service was good but the food even better. The view overlooking the SF bay was the perfect setting for our anniversary date. We were looking to try oysters so we took the managers advice and ordered a half dz Miyagi raw oysters and they were delicious. I then ordered the fish tacos n those were amazing. Blackend red snapper , yummmmmm! My husband had the popcorn shrimp and he was more than pleased . Not too salty or over batterd . They were lite fluffy n fresh. Needless to say this was a very pleasent experience. The perfect place to end our "honeymoon" wknd. We will b visiting again soon i hope.
author: Cherie C.

description: The woman stood in the street and ask to everyone come in to the restaurant... We stopped by. Very not comfortable. A few people. Baked oysters I make much better at home. Not tasty and expensive. We will not come here again.
author: Svitlana T.

description: Bread: bad. How can bread be bad? It was. Bad service. Worse than bread. Don't recommend. Ever.
author: Chris F.

description: Very disappointed in this restaurant. First thought it was affiliated with the Grotto in Monterey which it is NOT. There was no greeter at the front we just walked in then someone saw us and sat us down. After ordering they brought food out to us which wasn't our order. Ordered fried calamari appetizer it was cold. When the food finally came out two orders of the halibut and mashed potatoes. It was also cold. They got one of our orders wrong and our friend had to wait till they cooked her food. The only saving grace is that they were apologetic and gave us desert on them and our server credited the calamari. Would not recommend this place.
author: Nancy C.

description: The view from this restaurant was nice and the food was good . We enjoyed happy hour and we were looking forward to listening to the pianist, however we did not get to . They allowed two men to sit next to my husband and I with our daughter, these men had extremely poor hygiene and they were known to not pay after dining . So why they would serve them after confronting them about the issues ? Who knows . But this made our experience terrible . We asked to move to let our daughter finish eating in peace because the men were arguing and cursing amongst each other about the whole incident of the managers going up to them ; which was inconvenient for us because we had planned to watch the pianist and we couldn't see him anymore after we had to move . We will not be going back here .
author: Jesika A.

description: Under new ownership.    Not the same. Better Clam chowder soup before and I like the old fashion slice sourdough much better. Nice remodeling!
author: Kerry J.

description: Instead of waiting to sit down, you can grab some seafood at their stand south of the hostess stand. I always wanted to try Dungeness crab during the season, and boy is it all it's cracked up to be! Very sweet and delicious. The nice chatty guy at the stand will also open a few oysters for you, the best and freshest on the wharf as far as I'm concerned.
author: Michele D.

description: First time eating at this historic restaurant and I will be back again soon. Politely greeted upon my arrival. Love the decor of the place & the live beehive is super cool. Got an awesome table with a breathtaking view and Enjoyed everything I ordered! The crab donuts are AMAZING! they're kind of like a fried battered crab cake. Oysters were tasty, Cesar salad was refreshing & the best of all the garlic crab!! I literally couldn't stop eating & had to put my bib on. The staff here is really polite, from the hostess, our server and manager. Orlando came by and thanked us for coming & overall made sure we had a satisfying experience. Super nice vibe in this place. Good seafood, great atmosphere, and staff is a five star!
author: Andria B.

description: Very nice establishment, breathtaking view, excellent service. Beers are $6 such comes with bread and butter. Extensive menue but on the high end. Predominantly sea food, pastas.
author: Laura k.

description: This is my first and last to come here. The food is so plain. Especially the chicken alfredo pasta and burger.
author: Kim E.

description: Being reopened for 18 months they haven't figured out the service yet.  Food is decent but service could be better.  We ordered bowtie pasta for the kiddo and the server brought out quesadilla, then fish and chips, and finally got it right.  The table that came after us got their cioppino first and we waited for our 15 minutes later.  The blackened snapper was bland - what saved it was the rice and greens.
author: Anthony T.

description: Would never come back again , food not bad . Service awful , to wait for anything takes anywhere 10-20 min even for a freaking check. Drinks don't even ask it's like first time they are making it . Server was lost , not helpful just made my blood boil . When you pay 200-300 for a dinner I am sorry service needs to be on point
author: Olga U.

description: Food was delicious! My boyfriend and i ordered a crab melt, shrimp pasta , and lobster mac n cheese. Our favorite being the crab melt! Highly recommend it. Servers were on top of everything , very attending and had good conversation. I rarely go into places and have a manager check on the satisfaction of our service at the end so it was really nice that Marvin approached the table, gave us his business card and made sure we were happy . Also want to point out that the dining setting was beautiful as well. Thanks Grotto!
author: Ingrid L.

description: Food was okay but not worth the price. We were flagged outside by a host and she said the crab price was $8 a lb (too good to be true, right?) Anyway, she got us to go in and we ordered 2 garlic crabs. The bill came out to be $118. We paid and talk to the host outside and told her the crabs were more than what she said they were. She showed us a picture on her phone of the price she took from the kitchen (yes, it was $8 a lb). So we went and talk to a manager (Robert) and he said he will contact me the next day after he talk to the office about the refund. I call the next day to find out he quit his job and of course, nothing was mention about my refund.  Another manager named Lisa told me she will take care of it but of course she is refusing to answer my phone calls. Never will I dine this place again!
author: Kathy T.

description: Had cousins from Ohio visiting and decided to have lunch here. They had really good lunch specials. I had a cup of clam chowder, crab melt sandwich and a salad for less than $20. My cousin had the same but with Fish and chips and I think we all fell in love with her plate. Also, the rating is for the service. Service was amazing from the moment we stepped in. Will definitely be returning for the Fish and chips!
author: Alane N.

description: I had lunch at the Grotto for the first time and was disappointed by the food. I'm my experience I paid for the ambiance and view. I ordered the shrimp scampi and it was bland had a total of 5 shrimp, for $30 it's not what I was expecting. My son had a quesadilla that was cold and overpriced $10, it came with some stale chips and unimpressive guácalamole. The worst was my husband meal, after waiting for over 40 minutes to finally get his crab, it came with a nice black hair in it too.
author: Samantha R.

description: I came here on a night with my family for some crab. That's exactly what I got. FRESH, garlic crab. We started out with the calamari and pop corn shrimp. Our server was Armando, he caterd to our every need and I never had to ask him for anything. His service was on point. The MOD was Marvin and he came to our table a few times to check on us and ask us how we were and talked to us. I personally like when Managers engage with customers it makes the experience even better and more personal. My crab was cooked perfectly. Butter on the side and a ton of fresh garlic in the sauce. My son had chicken fingers and even got a small treat of ice cream and cookies after. I'll definitely be coming back to the Grotto for the service and food. Hope to see both of them again. Thank you.
author: Angelina Q.

description: I recently went to the Grotto due to the redesign. The redesign is nice, and I really like the bar area with the fireplace -- it's modern, mod and clean. The food was ok to good but the service was slow and unattentive. The waiter was not very friendly and seemed aloof. I noticed they had a lot of staff on site although it wasn't very busy so I was confused to why the service was so slow. I had to ask for my cocktail twice and it only arrived when my food came. I also ordered crab, and the crab utensils (e.g., cracker/tongs) didn't come out until a few minutes after the crab -- therefore, my meal was cold.
author: Jessica S.

description: Classic SF restaurant . Wonderful ambience , including the music! The views of the piers are phenomenal and overall it is a great experience. Crab cakes tastes really good, with special mention to the salad , also did the Dungeness crab sandwich, and of course the red snapper. My only complaint was that they didn't bring the sides that were included in the kids meal.
author: Roberto V.

description: So I had been here when the previous owners were here and it was great. I went back two days ago with my boyfriend for lunch and the food was fabulous. Why am I giving it one star you ask? I got a notification that my checking account had been depleted. Low and behold all the charges had come from this restaurant. Beware people! Idk if it was a server or if someone had tapped their card scanner, but either way I don't think I'll be coming back. Not unless I want my money stolen again.
author: Samantha W.

description: The best fish and chips I've ever had. The service was amazing. Will definitely be coming back.
author: Kyle V.

description: I definitely regret not reading their reviews before going. Checked this place out since we were visiting San Francisco and wanted some good oysters and clam chowder. The clam chowder was alright, but the oysters were pretty small. I also had the capriccio which was pretty bland. I just haaaad to ask the other patrons what they thought of the food and they said they wouldn't recommend nor return. Not to mention, our waiter was inattentive. Very much lacking customer service. Definitely wouldn't return again.
author: R R.

description: This place has a nice ambiance and setting. It has a clear view of San Francisco Golden Gate Bridge and the city of San Francisco. Located in fisherman's wharf and close distance to pier 39. We ordered the clam chowder of course, which came with oysters crackers and sourdough  bread. Also they validate for parking, two hours free.
author: Enrique D.

description: After having gone to Fishermans Grotto #9 for over 40 years we were very disappointed. Our server had NO CLUE. When I asked how much crab was in the two Crab Louie's he said 6oz and 8oz - so I asked, . . ." for $28 you get 6 oz of crab and when you get the full size ($45) you get 2 more ozs?" --I don't think so. My dining partner asked about a spinach that was with the stuffed sole and his explanation of the dish was to read back the label on the menu. . . .poor guy was not trained at all. Bottom line is that the new owners had a wonderful chance to carry on a S.F. tradition and sadly IMHO they failed miserably. I am really bummed as I come to the City from my home in Chicago at least once a year and Grotto #9 was my favorite seafood destination. No more.
author: Michael R.

description: They weren't ready to open even though it took them almost 2 years. Service is dreadfully slow and hopeless. Food is remarkably uninteresting. Beautiful space, though.
author: Yowz A.

description: You are paying for the view.  The service was very good, but the food was mediocre for its price. Bartender not so hot (moscow mule tased like a Tom Collins). Otherwise, they had good sourdough, crab cakes were good.   I can't say I will be back. Nothing awful, but.....
author: Seth W.

description: My first seafood in San Francisco. Crab is good and also oysters. They didn't let me go upstairs because I ordered at the desk but it's a good spot.
author: Marie-Claire L.

description: Fishermans platter was a bit overpriced for what you receive and a little underwhelming.  The chowder was decent but lacked a little flavor.  Oyster Rockefeller were amazing.  The view is incredible from upstairs, but probably wouldn't return.  It seemed a bit of a tourist trap restaurant.
author: Ryan O.

description:
Had the swordfish and it was very good. Bread is fresh and hot. Nice wine by the glass selection. The room has been refreshed and very inviting. Looks to be good for parties or events.
Definitely will return.
author: Mike S.

description: Great view and they were able to accommodate a large party last minute. However the food leaves a lot to be desired. A LOT. Our party was very unimpressed with the quality for the price. Service was decent, the hostess was very polite; drinks were refilled after we finished our meal.
author: Sandra And Barry G.

description: I don't think I've ever left a bad yelp review but I had to do it for this place. We decided to eat here after looking at their online menu. After the hostess seated us, nothing on the menu was the same as online. We contemplated leaving, but we were already seated and had ordered drinks. This place has ridiculously high prices for mediocre food. The hostess' were not friendly either. Won't be going here again. If you're looking for a place with great good & great service, this isn't it.
author: Peyton S.

description:
I went to The Grotto for Valentines day and had a great experience! I'm so happy we decided to check out The Grotto. I will definitely be back again. For appetizer we ordered the crab donuts. I highly recommend you to order them. They're delishhhh. I ordered the lobster mac and cheese and the boyfriend ordered cioppino. Both our dishes were yummy!
The service was great and I really appreciated the check in from the manager to make sure we were doing okay.
author: Jenelle R.

description: Zero Stars for this place.....sitting here waiting on our food and everyone who ordered after us have gotten thier food!!! All we ordered were fresh oysters and a appetizer platter.!!!  Really ...not only that we havent gotton our refill on some freaking water.... never offered hot bread!!! 4 different times they have come to our table thinking it FINALLY our food!! Nope these people getting wrong plates to wrong peoples table!!! Im so disappointed!!
author: Monique M.

description: I ordered a coke and I'm still waiting. Lol I don't like writing bad reviews but I felt like the service here was not good. I mean the food is not cheap so you kinda expect good service... and it wasn't like they were swamped because then maybe I would understand. I ordered a drink she never brought it. My boyfriend asked for sweet and low and she finally brought it when he was done with his bland  tea. It just kinda felt like she felt like she was doing us a favor by helping us. Oh and the food was just ok.
author: C A.

description: Good atmosphere friendly staff and a must for Happy Hour pricing!! Only went for Happy Hour but they had good drinks and cheap oysters
author: Jamie S.

description: Came here with my Grandfather since he came to no.9 on his honeymoon with my grandmother back in the 50s. Very impressed with the location, view, and atmosphere. The lobster Mac and cheese was over peppered but otherwise the food was delicious. However the slow service and snobby attitudes were off putting. To say they were inattentive is sugar coating it. Also the hostesses need some attitude checks. If you're looking to impressed with a fake ambiance this is your place, but otherwise there's better seafood to be found with friendlier staff.
author: Kristen A.

description: The restaurant has been totally remodeled and the food was excellent. I will be back again. I thought I would miss the old decor but it was about time to bring the Grotto into the 21st century.
author: Kevin V.

description: Outstanding food, but the atmosphere is sparse. Staff are the friendliest around. The daily specials are the best deal in the area.
author: Laura C.

description: Our family has been going to Grotto Number 9 for many years. We went back tonight for the first time since it re-opened under new ownership and LOVED it! Carlos gave us excellent service and was friendly and personable. The food was wonderful and was served quickly. The new decor and ambiance was beautiful, updated and clean. Can't recommend the Grotto enough! Old school charm, great service, delicious and filling food, tasty drinks!
author: Megan M.

description: Visited the Grotto on 11-6-17 and it is still closed, but we were told they would be having a soft opening the following week for friends and family and open for business thereafter. They were serving clam chowder and drinks in front on the patio and we didn't hesitate to grab a seat. Happy to report that their chowder has not changed a bit, sour dough bread is fresh and still tasty as ever!!  This restaurant was one of our favorites while visiting the city and so happy to hear they will be opening shortly.
author: Pam M.

description: The Fishermen's Grotto Restaurant run by previous owner was my favorite but the new one was so disappointing. I read that the new owners were going to keep some the main dishes. Clam chowder was oily & tasted more like bacon. My husband didn't like the halibut & my pawns served on a bed of lettuce were tasteless. The butter or margarine was flat & tarter sauce tasted like watery mayonnaise. The side of penne pasta was served with same butter. Service was slow. The place looks beautiful & views are exceptional. It's too bad I can't say more about the food. We were there 5 days ago.
author: Mary J.

description:
First the positive...my husband and I were seated right away and the table was located in the far end of the dining room with an incredible view. The waiter took our order promptly and was very friendly. Our cocktails were generous and delicious! The shrimp cocktail was fresh and yummy!
On the other hand there were some hiccups...the entrees could have been better. My linguini with clams lacked spice and was missing the garlic bread that was listed on the menu. The waiter never returned during our meal so I could not request my bread. My husband had fish tacos that he liked but the rice accompaniment was dry. There was a very large party of like 20 people with screaming kids that ruined the ambiance for some time. It would probably be better to have some separation between large parties and couples. All in all a good experience but some improvements can be made. Our meal was 150 with tip for 4 drinks an appetizer and 2 meals.
author: Michelle R.

description: I've been here when it was owned by the previous owners and it was great! first off we waited almost an hour for a table when no one else was waiting to be seated. Next the food took forever and not worth the prices. service was good very friendly waiters  the bread was also good along with the view but that's about it. you're better off getting food off the street.
author: Melissa N.

description:
Yes there are better seafood restaurants in the City but it is by far the best right now in Fishermans Wharf. Remodel of the physical space and menu--and maybe staff--has done wonders. Ordered three items, all were great:
- fried calamari (best tartar sauce of any seafood joint in SF)
- petrale sole (spinach was not described as "creamed" but was definitely in cream)
- large combo Louis salad (could easily have been split as an appetizer amongst three or four, thousand island dressing s'good)
Service fine (noon 12/29), bread yummy.
author: TL R.

description: Nice looking restaurant & good service! But the food was bland, pricey and really it was a disappointment, we were a family of 5 we did not order big and we still came out with a bill close to $200.00 um it would have been ok if it was delicious but it wasn't! I ordered the linguine and clams and The linguine taste like clam water no sauce taste at all! My sons shared a Mac & cheese lobster and it was sweet tasting and hardly had  any lobster but lots of pasta :( my husband ordered clam chowder and it wasn't good either it was quite watery! I ordered a beer and it wasn't even cold, we won't be going back or recommending it! It's a shame because the renovation is very nice & it's in a great location but they need to get better chefs or better recipe.
author: Lisa V.

description: This was by far the best restaurant we visited on our trip. The service was wonderful and the salmon is the best I've ever had. We will definitely return on our next trip!
author: Shawna E.

description: We have gone to this Fisherman's grotto for the pass 15 years we come from  Riverside CA  Saturday we we're at a wedding in Reno Nevada so we decided to drive to San Francisco for dinner since we like there lobster   what a disappointment  it was so small (2 inches) and paid $40 per person you get a bigger lobster at other places in Las Vegas Laughlin and in our local restaurants we won't be going there any more
author: Trini E.

description: Came here the weekend of Valentine's Day(since me and my girlfriend had to work Valentine's) so after coming into the city after a long trip we decided to try this spot out. I'll try to keep it short , awesome customer service shout out to Raul our server , felt like everything was given to me in my lap without fussing and I just got to enjoy my meal and atmosphere with my Gf. I had the Cioppino felt like comfort food for the cold SF night especially when soaking my bread into it. Loved the service , delicious food and beautiful view can't ask for much more (also shout out to Marvin that night also for a warm welcoming) definitely a relaxing evening.
author: Jaimen R.

description: Well my BFF and I wanted seafood so we went here since I had been there before and was pleased with the service and the food. It has since changed ownership. I was told by phone that they would honor the Groupon that I had purchased. However, after our meal they said that they wouldn't honor it. After paying for our meal and including a $9 tip, we left. The next day I look at my online banking to discover that someone at the restaurant took my $9 tip and turned it into a $90 tip.  I called several times to speak with a manager only to be told that a manager is unavailable and would call me back. After calling for 3 straight days, I was finally able to speak with a manager. The only thing they did was refund the amount that was over the tip amount and gave a half ass apology. POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE. I will not be dining there again.
author: Ericka A.

description: Apologize for grammatical errors in advance but need to get to point. I rate this a zero. My husband was steered blindly here by a bunch of reviews on yelp and thought this would be a nice place to go for my birthday dinner. Even our concierge said it was "under new management. Horrible food and tourist trap." She offered to get us a reservation at a steak house that was hard to get into. Really didn't want steak though. All I wanted was crab. I mean, if you've been in business that long and San Fran is known for its crab, you would think they cannot possibly screw up steaming a crab. They served the crab two ways. I relied on server to help me with choice. He brought me this crab(I think it was frozen previously. ) It was loaded with this awful oil. I sent it back and got the plain one. Frozen before too. Hard to peel. Couldn't finish it. So disappointed. Oh and we were one of 3 tables in the place in a prime touristy area if that tells you anything. Epically horrible.
author: Sarah M.

description: Thanks to John at the bar for a great lunch. Killer burger, killer service. Beautiful location.
author: Brett M.

description: I can't say enough about how wonderful our experience was at this restaurant. We were there for lunch on Saturday, April 21st.  From the minute we walked in the door it was amazing, the hostess was very friendly, wait staff was friendly and attentive and the food was delicious.  We ate inside upstairs and it was beautiful.  Thank you all!
author: Kimberlee E.

description: The ambiance is beautiful. Nothing really stand out. Food was mediocre at best. The oysters they serve are really small. We asked the waitress for lemon, but she forgot. We had to flag down a waiter for it. Good to try as a one time but not to return.
author: Kyle L.

description: If you are looking for the old No9 Grotto, don't come here. It was sold and under new management, new chef. The place received a nice makeover but the food was terrible. I had the stuffed Sole and found at least 2 pin bones, my wife had the clam chowder and it was gritty as if the clams had not been cleaned properly, the crab melt tasted of only lemon, couldn't taste the crab or cheese at all. Their solution was to offer a free small bowl of ice cream which we declined. Definitely a tourist trap now and should be avoided.
author: Ignacio Y.

description: I came in for a late lunch/dinner and the entire experience was perfect. To start the decor within the restaurant is amazing. They have many vintage items that illuminate the entire place. For an appetizer I had the crab donuts. These were incredible and are possible the crab dish I have ever eaten. For my entree I had the lobster Mac n Cheese. The multi-cheese mac perfectly complemented the large portion of lobster. I finished with an excellent slice of blueberry cheese cake. My meal came out very quickly and the customer service was exceptional. My waiter notice anything that was missing from the table. The best part of the service was the manger, Marvin (I believe lost the business card) visited the table with every meal to check in and see how we were enjoying it. This place is a must stop if you are in or around San Francisco.
author: Skylynd R.

description: Don't go there, tasteless food, bad services. Food takes for ever to come. The server forgot our food order till he came and asked if we got our food or not. At the end when we asked about the check. He brought the check with the tip written down already. He decided to write the tip already so we just sign.  They are operating under fisherman grotto no. 9 but it seems this restrung closed down and replaced by the grotto of SF. JUST DON'T GO THERE.
author: Haytham A.

description: Really great service and hidden gem in touristy Fisherman's Wharf. Cozy upstairs bar with fireplace and piano. Second time back and not disappointed!
author: Fiona R.

description: 5 stars for the food.  1 star for the service.  We sat down and made our selections fairly quickly.  The waiter took our order -- and then we waited for over 15 minutes..  The promised water and bread never arrived.  Finally our appetizers arrived -- Calamari for my wife and clam chowder for me.  But no spoon for the chowder.  The waiter assured me that he'd bring me one right away.  10 minutes later, no spoon, no water, no bread.  We flagged a waiter down and this time got the spoon, water and bread.  But the 14 oz. wine my wife requested somehow turned into only a 6 oz. glass.  And I question if it was even 6 oz.  When the meal arrived it was delicious.  Then, after we finished and the plates were removed we waited over 10 minutes for the cheque and then over 10 minutes for my credit card and the cheque to be taken.  Then another 10 minutes for them to be returned.
author: Bill N.

description: really bad service. it took them 30 minutes to give us bread & an hour to serve our food.
author: Brianna L.

description: Pasta is salty and steak is hard. We only order half a dozen of oyster but one dozen is served.
author: Jiaqi L.

description: Delicious and super fresh food, great service, beautiful dining room with fabulous views, very impressed with all the details of the food, service and decor. Plan to revisit often.
author: Karen M.

description: Great view of the marina, clam chowder was ok, lobster Mac and cheese was not very good, linguini and clams was average, service was good.  Overall it's kind of expensive but ok to eat at if you just want eat on the marina.
author: Ca A.

description: Stopped by for lunch today and it was awesome. Food and atmosphere where great!  The fish tacos and fish and chips where delicious.  Just a note-the restaurant is located on the second floor of the Fishermans Grotto #9. No sign out front at this point.
author: Erin G.

description: The food is over priced and terrible. Nothing has flavor. Don't waste your money or time. You're better off eating with the street vendors downstairs
author: Tiffany G.

description: If your in the bay and want to have a boujie lunch or dinner this is the spot. The ambience and locations is great. Food is as expected and I can't complain. Only thing I didn't like is the manager kept passing by looking at us as if we were unfit to be in the restaurant, I am young but either way it made me feel uncomfortable. When I put down two new hundred dollar bills she grabbed them instead of my server. Then she came back and gave me the most in-genuine "thanks for coming." I assume you have to wear a suite and Rolex to come here without being doubted. Everything else was great besides her. I guess she had to triple check the hundreds I put down which is what you have the spend if you come here
author: Martin B.

description: I have been going to this place literally my entire life and I'm beyond disappointed with our experience today. I bragged to my family how good the food was, about the old nostalgic feel with the fisherman carpet and the old school waiters who were all about service. This was not the place I grew up with. We were seated immediately and it took about 10 minutes for anyone to come. The waiter was nice enough, but we had to ask 2-3 times to get anything, like Tabasco for our clam chowder and crayons for the kids to color on their menus. Another guy flat out waived us off and ignored us when we asked for something g The same waiter was serving every single table. The food was good, and the view is the best, so that's the only reason for the second star. We took home our leftovers to find out that my boyfriend's lobster Mac and cheese was placed ON TOP of my crab Louis salad. I'm the same box (packed by the dude that ignored us). Very disappointed with this experience, it's not the place I grew up on and can't say I'll be going back :(
author: Amber F.
